support_summary: ATXN3 stabilizes BECN1, which physically interacts with BCL2 to regulate autophagy

functions.cellular_process: Relief of BCL2-mediated inhibition of autophagy initiation.
functions.effect_description: By stabilizing Beclin-1, ATXN3 increases the pool of Beclin-1 that can bind to and sequester BCL2, thereby preventing BCL2 from blocking the assembly of the PI3K-III complex.
biological_consequence: ATXN3 deubiquitinates Beclin-1 (K402) → Stabilizes Beclin-1 protein → Increased Beclin-1/BCL2 complex formation → Sequestration of BCL2 away from other targets → Relief of autophagy inhibition → Enhanced autophagosome formation.
specific_effects: Increased Beclin-1 protein stability and half-life
Reduced inhibitory effect of BCL2 on the VPS34 complex

evidence.relevant_quote: Ataxin-3 deubiquitinates and stabilizes Beclin-1 to promote autophagy... This interaction allows the deubiquitinase activity of ataxin 3 to protect beclin 1 from proteasome-mediated degradation and thereby enables autophagy.

mechanism_correction: ATXN3 deubiquitinates and stabilizes Beclin-1 (BECN1), which is a key initiator of autophagy. Increased levels of Beclin-1 promote its interaction with BCL2, effectively sequestering BCL2 and preventing it from inhibiting the pro-autophagic VPS34 complex. This relief of inhibition enhances autophagic flux.
mechanism: Relief of BCL2-mediated inhibition of autophagy initiation.
effect: By stabilizing Beclin-1, ATXN3 increases the pool of Beclin-1 that can bind to and sequester BCL2, thereby preventing BCL2 from blocking the assembly of the PI3K-III complex.
summary: ATXN3 inhibits BCL2 to modulate beclin-1 stabilization & bcl2 sequestration, ultimately affecting enhanced autophagosome formation.

initial_pathway.reasoning: ATXN3 interacts with the BCL2-Beclin-1 complex to modulate the initiation and regulation of macroautophagy.
